title: First Customized Financial Literacy Program to Help Inculcate Saving Habits in Lower-Income Families
summary: This Sunday, South West Community Development Council (CDC) and Citi Singapore will launch the Citi-South West Family Save-and-Grow program. The new customized financial literacy program is part of the CDC's upstream intervention efforts to equip participating families, including their children, with financial management skills towards long-term financial independence. The program will reach out to a total of 50 needy families in 2013 and comprise three pilot features: matched savings for dual accounts of the families, a mentoring pairing with staff from Citi Singapore and a progressive financial literacy course.
tag-1: First Customized Financial Literacy Program to Help Inculcate Saving Habits in Lower-Income Families
tag-3: This Sunday, South West Community Development Council (CDC) and Citi Singapore will launch the Citi-South West Family Save-and-Grow program. The new customized financial literacy program is part of the CDC's upstream intervention efforts to equip participating families, including their children, with financial management skills towards long-term financial independence. The program will reach out to a total of 50 needy families in 2013 and comprise three pilot features: matched savings for dual accounts of the families, a mentoring pairing with staff from Citi Singapore and a progressive financial literacy course.
tag-4: Each family can receive up to $760 worth of savings and food vouchers per family over six months. The savings in the dual banking accounts of the families – namely the parents and child – will be matched to inculcate and encourage the habit of saving early, especially for the young. South West CDC will provide an initial deposit of $100 into a Basic Banking Account for the parent and $20 into a Junior Savings Account for the child to kick-start the program for these families. The savings will be tracked over six months, upon which they will be matched dollar-for-dollar up to $100 for the child's account and up to $300 for the parents' account. In addition, they can receive up to $240 worth of incentive food vouchers.
tag-5: Sixty staff from Citi Singapore will volunteer as mentors for this program with two mentors attached to each family. These mentors will meet with their families at the start and tail end of the program to share basic financial planning skills and encourage them as they save towards their monthly savings target. The families will also go through a progressive structured financial literacy course with two sessions of parent financial counseling and financial talk for the children. The first batch of 25 families will start on the program in January while the second batch of families will commence the program in mid-2013.
tag-6: Mayor Khor, South West district, said: "South West CDC is pleased to partner Citi Singapore to provide upstream intervention to needy families. Through the concerted efforts by Citi Singapore and South West CDC, the families and their children will become more self-sufficient and eventually be self-reliant. Fifty families under the Work Support (WS) Program and Home Ownership Plus Education (HOPE) scheme, with children between the ages of 7 and 16, will each undergo a six-month structured program comprising of three key components. Firstly, each family will undergo a mentoring program with Citi staff volunteers who will impart financial literacy skills and encourage the families to save. Secondly, incentives in the form of stationery and food vouchers will be provided to the families throughout the programs to motivate their efforts. Thirdly, this program will provide matched savings for dual accounts namely Junior Savings Account and Basic Banking Account to help the family build financial assets to prepare for rainy days. I look forward to more community-centric initiatives and collaboration with Citi Singapore to benefit more needy families."
tag-7: Mr. Han Kwee Juan, CEO of Citibank Singapore Limited, said: "We believe it is a responsibility and a natural extension of the work we do as a financial institution to help people understand how to manage their financial resources. Over the past 10 years, Citi Singapore has been committed to raise the quality of life for individuals and families through increased levels of financial literacy. The Citi-South West CDC Family Save-and-Grow program provides us with another opportunity to reach out to more Singaporeans and help inculcate the habit of saving to build a more secure financial future."
tag-8: The South West Community Development Council (CDC) Formed on November 24, 2001, the South West Community Development Council (CDC) functions as the local administration of the South West district. The three strategic thrusts of the South West CDC are Assisting the Needy, Bonding the People and Connecting the Community.
tag-9: The South West CDC provides social and employment assistance to help the less fortunate in our community. Through its functional committees, the South West CDC also organizes projects and programs to promote community bonding and social cohesion. The South West CDC adopts the "Many Helping Hands" approach to encourage community ownership among residents, community partners and corporations to realize its vision of "Owning Your Community."
